meanings.definition: A person who is not a Freemason.
meanings.sent1: The cowan watched the Freemasons from afar.
meanings.sent2: The cowan was not allowed to enter the Masonic lodge.
meanings.sent3: The cowan tried to sneak into the secret meeting but was caught.
meanings.sent4: Being a cowan in the Freemason world is like being an outsider in a close-knit group.
meanings.sent5: The cowan's curiosity about Freemasonry grew each day.

meanings.definition: To act as a cowan, or to work without proper knowledge or skill.
meanings.sent1: He decided to cowan his way through the project, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to cowan her way into trouble by pretending to know more than she did.
meanings.sent3: The team laughed when he tried to cowan his way through the complex task.
meanings.sent4: Trying to cowan your way through life will only lead to mistakes and misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: She realized it was better to ask for help than to cowan her way through challenges.
